result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: See CCAP Financial Payment Plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP case # 2022CF000716.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 3:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 20 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence, with credit for 5 days served; Huber privileges for work, medical and treatment.  Court has no objection against electronic monitoring.  

Defendant ordered to pay a fine in the amount of $700.00 plus costs, penalties and surcharges or a civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept. Defendant is to pay $25.00 a month starting January 1st, 2023. 

Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for 2 YEARS.  Court orders all vehicles owned by the defendant must be equipped with an ignition interlock device for a period of 24 MONTHS.

Drivers Safety Assessment ordered.

Defendant Sylwia Katarzyna Hass in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Drug Treatment Court

AS TO COUNT 1:
Parties are prepared to enter into a Deferred Sentencing Agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty and entered Judgment of Conviction as charged in the Information.  Defendant enters into Drug Treatment Court (DTC) with the sentencing deferred.  Deferred Sentencing Agreement received and filed.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 3:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 17.  Review hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.
Court scheduled for a plea hearing and an entry into DTC on Friday, August 5th, 2022. Due to reasons discussed with the parties, court rescheduled the hearing for August 17th, 2022 at 3:00 pm.
Defendant is eligible for DTC. Case adjourned for entry.
JusticePoint Services Violation Report (new criminal charges), filed.

Defendant Sylwia Katarzyna Hass in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Defendant may qualify for DTC. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Sylwia Katarzyna Hass in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 35.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 03-15-2022.
JusticePoint Services Violation Report (missed phone contact), filed.
Signed and filed, CPAU No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with NRH (05/14/2021)

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Sylwia Katarzyna Hass in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Sylwia Katarzyna Hass in custody.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sylwia Katarzyna Hass appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
